pageCollection.title: Oh wow, three bowls of porridge!
pageCollection.text: After gingerly entering the secluded log cabin, you are immediately struck by a powerful smell of bear shit.//Normally, such an offensive stench would repulse even the hardiest forest explorer. But you're ravenous after wandering the woods for days. And this dwelling is the only sign of civilisation you've encountered since you lost your way.//You quickly suppress your nausea, and press on through the dark hallway stretching out in front of you. The earthy stink and the cold silence of the wooden passage form an oppresive barrier that seems to almost thicken the air in front of you. Girding yourself against the near-tangible sensation of being forced back by the sensory onslaught unfurling from the bowels of the creaking shack, you force your trembling legs to carry you towards the door a few feet ahead of you.//Moving is clumsy while you endure stabs of hunger in your stomach. And a blinding headache joins the cacophony of ways your body is telling you you need food.//You lumber into the room as you roughly shoulder past the door. The sight that greets you instantly dissipates your pains.//Three bowls of porridge sit on a large oak dining table.//The leftmost bowl is the largest, and seems to gently radiate a dull orange glow whilst soft vents of steam twirl from it into the dusty rafters.//The middle bowl is less than half the size of its large neighbour, and seems ethereally still. The lack of movement on its moist, beige surface is borderline hypnotic.//Finally, the last bowl would be most accurately described as a thimble. But despite that, it has an oddly dignified air to it. A modest gravitas that renders it endearing.//You can barely restrain yourself: /b/which serving of porridge do you devour first?/b/

destinationCollection.label: The large bowl on the left
